intro: Clidemia leptostachya, commonly known as silverleaf or whiteleaf miconia, is a tropical flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests and is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets. Due to its invasive potential, it is considered a problematic species in some regions.
